referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: Let the emergency vehicle pass and follow it closely behind.
Immediately come to a stop.
Pull over to the left until the emergency vehicle passes.
questions.qn: Generally, if you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle you should -

options: Slow down and stop if necessary to prevent getting in its way.
Keep driving because you have the green light.
Pull over to the left before you reach the intersection
questions.qn: You are approaching a green light in vehicle A. An ambulance sounding its siren is approaching the same intersection and has a red light. You should -

options: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Overtake the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Drive carefully at no more than 40 km/h.
questions.qn: When you see these lights flashing on the back of a bus, what should you do?

options: Only on roads that do not have street lights.
On any road, even if there are street lights.
On any road where the speed limit is above 80 km/h.
questions.qn: You are driving at night and there is no other traffic around you. When can you use your headlights on high beam?

options: Leave your headlights on high beam.
Park on the footpath.
Pick a visible position or leave the parking or hazard lights on.
questions.qn: You want to park your vehicle for a short time. It is night time. You should -

options: Speed up and drive over the gravel as quickly as possible.
Check the mirrors and change lanes.
Slow down.
questions.qn: You drive up to a corner where you see some loose gravel on the road. You should -

options: The right lane to avoid slow-moving vehicles.
The left lane unless you are overtaking.
Whichever lane has the least traffic.
questions.qn: When you are driving on a two-lane freeway, which lane should you choose?

options: The right lane is reserved for overtaking.
The right lane is for emergency vehicles only.
The right lane is for avoiding most traffic.
questions.qn: When there are three lanes on a freeway -

options: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Drive past the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Be careful, there may be children about.
questions.qn: When you see the headlights flashing on the front of a bus, what should you do?

options: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.
No, never.
Yes, provided you stop for a short time only and turn on your hazard warning lights.
questions.qn: You are driving your vehicle along a street and want to stop for a short time. Are you allowed to double park your vehicle (that is stand it on the road alongside a parked car)?

options: At least 20 metres.
At least 50 metres.
At least 5 metres.
questions.qn: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?

options: No.
Yes, but only when you stop at intersections.
Yes, but you must hold the steering wheel with at least one hand.
questions.qn: Are you allowed to use a hand-held mobile phone while driving a car?

options: No, being licensed is enough.
No it is only needed on long trips.
Yes.
questions.qn: Are you required to carry your driver's licence with you every time you drive?

options: They ride too fast and do not turn their lights on.
They are harder to see in traffic and do not have the same protection as many drivers.
They are careless and do not obey road rules.
questions.qn: Bicycle and motorcycle riders have the same rights to use the road as other motor vehicle drivers. They are, however, more at risk in traffic because -

options: Continually scan the road, looking ahead, to the sides, checking side and rear mirrors and anticipate what may happen.
Turn all your attention only to the road ahead.
Ask other occupants in the vehicle to watch out for possible dangers.
questions.qn: To drive safely, you need to concentrate and be able to monitor everything that is happening on the road. To do this, you need to -

options: Stop and give way to all traffic even if the intersection is clear.
Slow down and be prepared to give way to traffic on your right only, if there is any danger of a collision.
Slow down and be prepared to stop and give way to all traffic if there is any danger of a collision.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you must -

options: Come to a complete stop, look both ways for trains and proceed with caution if no trains are approaching.
Slow down, then drive slowly over the crossing looking both ways for trains
Stop, only if a train is at the crossing.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: Next main town 35 km to the right
Winding road ahead for next 35 km.
Slow down, the maximum safe speed around the next curve in the road is 35km/h.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Continue at the same speed and not look both ways for approaching trains
Slow down and be prepared to stop if the lights start flashing, warning you of an approaching train.
Stop in the middle of the railway tracks and look both ways for approaching trains.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: You can overtake vehicles only on the left side.
You must stay in the left lane and must not overtake any vehicles.
You must stay in or move to the left lane, unless you are overtaking another vehicle.
questions.qn: What does this sign means?

options: Drive quickly over the railway crossing.
Stop before the railway crossing, wait for 1 minute and proceed if the crossing is clear.
Slow down and be ready to stop and give way to a train.
questions.qn: When you see this sign, what must you do?

options: All traffic must turn back at the roundabout.
Slow down, be ready to stop and give way to all vehicles already on the roundabout if there is a danger of a collision.
Stop at all times and give way to all traffic on your right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Drive carefully, you are reaching the top of the hill and will not be able to see a safe distance in front of you.
Watch out, the road ahead may be flooded.
Slow down, there is a dangerous curve ahead.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: The road ahead is closed, go back.
There is a tunnel ahead, turn on your headlights.
There is a hump (sudden slope up and down) in the road ahead, slow down.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Animals are crossing the road ahead, stop and wait for directions.
There may be animals on or near the road ahead, slow down and be prepared to stop to avoid collision.
You are approaching an animal farm.
questions.qn: What does this sign tell you?

options: Drink black coffee.
Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.
Have a glass of water.
questions.qn: To reduce the effect of alcohol before driving or riding you should -

options: Not to drink any alcohol.
Drink 1 nip of spirits (30 ml or 1 oz).
Drink 1 middy (285 ml) of light (low alcohol) beer.
questions.qn: Before driving a motor vehicle or riding a motor cycle it is safest -

options: No, if you are a learner driver.
No, if you say you haven't been drinking alcohol.
Yes, always.
questions.qn: Is it an offence to refuse to take a POLICE breath test?

options: The alcohol will have less effect than if taken alone.
It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.
Your ability to react to emergencies will improve.
questions.qn: If you take medicine and then drink alcohol -

options: You may proceed only in the direction of the green arrow when the red light has changed to green.
You may proceed only in the direction of the green arrow.
You must give way to oncoming traffic.
questions.qn: You are facing traffic lights (as shown). What do they mean?

options: Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to green.
Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to yellow.
Stop, make sure there is no traffic, then drive straight ahead.
questions.qn: At traffic lights what is meant when a red light appears?

options: Permitted only when passing another vehicle
Only permitted when other vehicles are going faster than the speed limit.
Never legally permitted.
questions.qn: Driving faster than the maximum speed limit is -

options: 10 Km/h
20 Km/h
50 Km/h
questions.qn: A Shared Traffic Zone, where pedestrians and other road users can share the road safely has a speed limit of -

options: You can go faster than 60 km/h
You are not to exceed 60 km/h.
You are on Highway 60.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: All four people.
Only the driver.
Only the driver and front seat passenger.
questions.qn: A car is carrying a driver and 3 adult passengers. There are seat belts in all seating positions. By law, seat belts must be worn by -

options: Sitting in the back seat.
Not wearing the available seat belt.
Distracting the driver.
questions.qn: The adult passenger in the rear is breaking the law because she is -

options: Check over your shoulder.
Adjust your seat.
Put on your seat belt.
questions.qn: You are about to move away from the kerb in your car. What is the last thing you should do before you move into traffic?

options: When they are crossing from your left only.
When they are crossing from your right only.
If there is any danger of a collision.
questions.qn: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing -

options: Slow down and be ready to make a safe stop.
Come to a complete stop before the crossing
Go faster, in case a pedestrian steps onto the crossing.
questions.qn: When approaching a marked pedestrian crossing and no pedestrians are in sight, you should -

options: Yes, at all times.
Yes, if there is traffic on your right only.
No, if the intersection is clear.
questions.qn: The diagram shows a marked pedestrian crossing at an intersection. There is also a STOP sign at the intersection. You have already stopped for a pedestrian. Must you stop again at the STOP line?

options: Be ready to stop and give way to all other traffic if there is danger of a collision.
Stop completely at all times and have no right of way.
Slow down and only give way to traffic on your right.
questions.qn: A GIVE WAY sign at an intersection means that you must -

options: Stop, if you see a car with its right-hand indicator on.
Check for parked vehicles with turn signals on, or children about to step out.
Sound your horn and flash your headlights to warn drivers not to pull out.
questions.qn: When driving near parked vehicles, you should -

options: If you do not have a clear view of any approaching traffic.
If you cannot see clear road ahead for 100 metres.
If you cannot see clear road ahead for 75 metres.
questions.qn: You are approaching a hill or curve. You must not cross the centre line to overtake -

options: Get plenty of rest before starting out.
Make sure your horn is working.
Have a good meal before driving.
questions.qn: When going on a long trip, out of the following which is the most important to do?

options: Not look at its headlights, but keep left and watch the left of the road.
Carefully watch the vehicle by looking directly at its headlights.
Put your lights on high beam, to make your vehicle more easily seen.
questions.qn: At night, when you approach an oncoming vehicle, you should -
